Segment AB is a constant volume process.
Segment BC is a constant temperature process (hyperbola on pV = constant diagram).
Segment CD is a constant pressure process.

premise: Segment BC is a constant temperature process.
conclusion: Temperature at point D is the same as at point C.

Point B has the same volume as point A (V_B = V_A = 10 L).
At point C, V_C = 40 L, p_C = 2 atm.

premise: Using the ideal gas law pV = nRT at points A and C.
conclusion: Set up the ratio: (p_A V_A) / T_A = (p_C V_C) / T_C.

premise: Temperature at points C and D are the same.
conclusion: Temperature at point D is 600 K.
